item.title: MakerChip in trend
item.description:
In Japan, MakerChip is a very hot trend among 3D printer owners.

A MakerChip is coin shaped items, 40mm in diameter and 3mm depth. People use these chips as business cards.

The Japan RepRap Festival is a key factor driving this trend.

This event will be held on June 14th and 15th.

You can find many MakerChips on this page.

item.title: The Ultimate Geek-Chic Ruler for Makers
item.description:
How cool are those 7-segment style numbers and alphabets in the picture? They’re designed to delight!

All these drawings were made using this very special design ruler.

This creator transformed their passion into a true “product.” They sought out a Japanese factory with the expertise to perfectly realize their concept, working hand-in-hand with skilled craftsmen to ensure this ruler was built with exceptional quality and undeniable appeal.

from 7セグ数字やドットのアルファベットをきれいに書くためのデザイン定規

item.title: Create a Lid for Your Disposable Mask Box
item.description:
Ever notice how fragile disposable mask boxes can be?

One creator designed and printed a custom lid for theirs.

Small innovations like this are a great fit for anyone with a home 3D printer.

item.title: Transform a Cheap 3D Printer into a Pen Plotter
item.description:
Looking for the cheapest 3D printer?

This creator acquired an “Easythread K10” and adapted it into a functional pen plotter.

Though the printer itself isn’t high-quality, it makes for an ideal platform for plotting experiments.
